INT. COFFEE SHOP. WASHINGTON SQUARE PARK.- DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very late. It's quiet. Just the sounds of The City LINDA SANTANA CRAIG, an attractive Hispanic woman in her thirties, waits at the ELEVATED STATION for the F train. Linda looks great. She's dressed festively but tastefully Next to her is her eleven year old DAUGHTER, ALICIA. She twirling about the platform, still jazzed from the birthd party they attended in The City. Alicia wears a black dress with a pink cardigan and has a handbag. We notice a CHARM BRACELET with four-leaf clover her right wrist. The mother and daughter wait alone at one end of the stat platform. TWO TEENAGE BOYS wait at the other end. They speak soft, SLURRED SPANISH to each other. Linda gives the boys a glance and evaluates. She watches as Alicia spits a wad of gum into her mom's open hand. The Boys approach. Linda tenses. At the last second the b make a hard left turn and disappear down the stairwell. I quiet again. Linda relaxes, smiles at her daughter. The F TRAIN is rounding the final bend into the station. Their focus is on this train. It's getting closer, louder And so they don't see, don't hear the Boys coming back up stairwell behind them. Not until the boys have the mother and daughter boxed in the one who can hardly grow a mustache is showing them hi gun. Linda puts her arm around her daughter. Alicia looks terrified. The train roars INTO THE STATION as Linda quickly hands o her purse, her watch. She hands over her engagement ring her wedding band. One of the boys yanks Alicia's little purse away from her The other boy fumbles the wedding band. The ring CLANGS t the ground and rolls to a stop a few feet away. We hear MEN'S VOICES echoing up the stairwell. Now the Boys are boxed in. And starting to panic.

dialogues.speaker: -- THE TRAIN DOORS SLIDE OPEN --.
dialogues.text: The Boys see their way out and step into the last empty r car, leaving the mother and daughter alone on the platfor Through the window on the train, Linda stares at the boy holding her daughter's purse, her face hardening into a M OF CONTEMPT. The boy clocks it. Who does she think she is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When a HAND WITH TATTOOED KNUCKLES reaches out and stops car doors from closing. A forearm and gun extend out of that last subway car ... There's a muzzle flash... a distant POP... a cloud of smo ... a mist of blood... and Linda's body collapses on itse Alicia's face, shock, terror and blood. 2   EXT. SMITH STREET STATION -- LATER THAT NIGHT --   M. A WORKING CRIME SCENE, lots of uniforms and light, a whit sheet draped over Linda's body where it fell. BLUE AND RED LIGHT dances against the stairwell wall wher man is taking the stairs two at a time. Late thirties, bi plain clothes, he is SERGEANT JAMES CRAIG. When he reache the platform, he stops. Craig kneels before the white sheet. Peels it back. We st on him. We don't see what he sees. We just see how he see it. Then he turns... THE WEDDING BAND. It's been tagged and numbered as eviden Craig picks it right out of the chalk outline and slips i into his pocket. Alicia, wrapped in a blanket, standing next to a round po MATRON. The Matron is tenderly trying to clean Alicia's f Alicia locks eyes with Craig and stumbles towards him, he legs not quite working. Craig saves her from the stumble and envelops her, liftin her as the blanket falls to the ground. Alicia makes little gasping noises. Trying to speak but can't. Craig walking back now, carrying his entire world. He rea the stairwell and suddenly falls to one knee. Alicia gasp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closest UNIFORM puts a hand on his arm. A moment. Composure. A deep breath. Then as quickly as he went down he's back up. Craig looks back now, taking it all in. Is it real? Sees the cops looking at him, then begins down the stairs. WE DRIFT UP above the station until we find ourselves wit clear view of the southern tip of Manhattan, where the TW TOWERS STAND TALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUBTITLE: "Eight Years Later" Tiny kitchen, clutter, a MESSENGER BIKE hanging from hook the wall, a lot of books. There is a PHONE RINGING under bed. TYLER ROTH, early twenties, handsome, looking haggard. He sitting on the floor, shirtless, bed head, wrapped in a blanket. A GUITAR is on his lap. Tyler has propped some w worn, hand written pages of MUSIC against a box of off-br laundry detergent and is squinting at the notes, frustrat etched in his face. A forgettable BLONDE lies sleeping on the bed. Tyler, not a born musician, is trying to teach himself on the PHRASES OF MUSIC in front of him. He is completely lo in the moment, with DEEP GROOVES in his fingers. By the ASHTRAY next to him, we can tell he's been at this a coup of hours. The Blonde in the bed re: the ringing phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Tyler gropes around the floor with one hand until he find phone, simultaneously glancing at the digital clock. His widen in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I'm on my way. I know...I know...I know...I know. Tyler climbs out of his blanket and yanks on a pair of da suit pants. Before he pulls on his white undershirt we observe a TATTOO that simply says "Michael" over his hear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He searches through a beat-up chest of drawers, seeking a reasonably clean button down shirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gandhi said that whatever you do in life will be insignificant but it is very important that you do it... ...And scrubs at a mysterious stain on the shoulder of an expensive but worn to hell suit jacket with a dishwasher brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I tend to agree with the first part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cluster of MOURNERS stand before a tombstone in the distance. They are not in funeral dress, as this is not a funeral. It's a memorial. A beat up GYPSY CAB with a WEST INDIAN DRIVER pulls to a stop. From the trees and the sky we know its LATE SPRING/EARLY SUMMER. A gorgeous day. Tyler gets out of the cab, holding the rim of his empty coffee cup in his teeth. He sorts a rumpled wad of single and hands some to the driver, who screeches into reverse. Time is money. Tyler crushes the coffee cup flat and slips it in his jac pocket then lights up a smoke. He takes one long drag the extinguishes it and slips the butt into his pocket. He be towards the mourners. His mother... DIANE HOFFMAN, a beauty. Past burdens etche the lines on her face. Dressed tastefully in expensive bohemian. She smiles like someone who's been crying but doesn't want anyone to know she has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweetly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, your majesty. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine... you look good... He kisses his mother's hand and he's moving to greet his stepfather... LES HOFFMAN, Unruly curls streaked in gray, tweed jacket tie. They exchange a firm handshake and muttered hellos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weight of Tyler's gaze falls to CAROLINE ROTH, his diminutive bespectacled, eleven year old sister. She's holding a little paper bag. She flashes him a look. He kneels besides her and whisper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for organizing everybody. Caroline makes a face. Turns her nose away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smell like Listerine and beer. He snorts and kisses her cheek. Caroline reaches into her bag and takes out a handful of smooth white stones, on which she has painted the names: "Mom" "Tyler" "Les", "Dad", "Caroline". She begins to arr them in a little circle on the grave. Tyler's father... CHARLES ROTH, late fifties, breathes power, precisely dressed, two hundred dollar haircut. A predator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside, to Tyler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't wear a tie? Tyler holds his father's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could have. Beat. Charles adjusts his own collar like it's an explosive. POV: The Tombstone. The four adult family members stand s by-side. They look like strangers on the subway as Caroli sits on the ground, arranging the stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family sits together in a booth. Tyler rolls a Bic lighter over his knuckles. Caroline draws a funny portrai Tyler on her napkin. He is smoking nine cigarettes at onc Diane gives the menu a ridiculous amount of attention. Le eyeing the Cheesecake. Charles subtly aligns his silverwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...This is nice... I think it's nice that we still do this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Mom. DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot. I'm trying to purge "nice" from my vocabulary. Michael would like that we still do this. Tyler takes out a cigarette. Lights it. Without saying a his mother takes it and snubs it out in an empty water gl DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Caroline) Did you tell Tyler what your art teacher said about your portrait? Caroline, as bemused as an eleven year old can be, looks her mother, then at her brother. She adopts a very mother tone. CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler, did I tell you what my art teacher said about my portrait? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why no, Caroline. What did your art teacher say about your portrait? DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) You two. I quit. She flickers a glance at her ex husband and squeezes Les' hand. CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...She was very impressed. She said I captured a moment like a young James Whistler. The WAITRESS brings platefuls of extravagant cheesecake t the table. Les dives in. Charles is having toast. He sips glass of water and takes a surreptitious glance at his Pa Phillippe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Whistler... good... 'cause Whistler really fell off late in his career. He's the Michael Jackson of European art history. DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She suggested your sister take Pratt's Summer Art Intensive and that's hugely prestigious. Caroline looks a bit sheepish, Tyler high fives Caroline. Diane, again, flickers a glance at Charles. CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would be the youngest one, ever, practically... CHARLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler, would you please pass the butter? Beat. DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline was speaking. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Charles) Are you really this clueless? Are you really dismissing her like this? Diane touches Caroline's hair. CHARLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline is perfectly capable of speaking up if she is feeling dismissed. Caroline, are you feeling dismissed? CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. CHARLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (solicitous, to Caroline) I didn't mean to change the subject. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the subject?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The subject we were discussing. What was it? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now's not the time for your heroics Tyler

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's the perfect time. Charles makes a minute adjustment to his collar. Father and son lock eyes until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering, to Caroline)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need me to take you anywhere? Caroline shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stay with mom. Diane glares at her ex-husband. Tyler rises and kisses his sister's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll see you after school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay. He exits as Caroline sips her lemonade, avoiding everybod eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler standing although there are a few seats available. car window strobes behind him. He takes off his jacket an button down and ties them both around his waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler in his pants and white tee shirt looks completely o of place amidst all the business types. He sits in the last booth facing the street. His tattered JOURNAL lies open in front of him, a BINDER CLIP holds hi page as he works quietly crafting an entry. The HOSTESS, tired, in her 60's, slides a piece of baklav the table as she shuffles past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat something. Tyler gives her a huge grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler and his roommate, AIDAN BREWER, 22, energetic, inappropriate, walking west towards N.Y.U. Young people i easy, summery dress. Tyler smokes. Aidan doesn't. Aidan remembers something, smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sold your girlfriend a toothbrush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sold my who? ...What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That voluptuous, delightfully oblivious little blonde you left in your bed this morning... I sold her a toothbrush. Got three bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Congratulations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are in order, yes. Because that sale inspired our newest business venture: "The S.L.U.T."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was unaware we had a previous business venture.

dialogues.speaker: AIDAN
dialogues.text: The 'Single Lady's Universal Tote'. It's the one-night-stand travel pack for women. We throw in some make-up, toiletries, cell phone charger, cab numbers. Retail it at S19.95, maybe do an infomercial.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: And you think women would buy this? With money?

dialogues.speaker: AIDAN
dialogues.text: Hey one-night-stands happen... It's a part of life... like stubbing your toe. Sometimes you misjudge a corner and bend back your pinky toe, other times you wake up in a freshman dorm wearing a field hockey tee shirt wondering why your balls smell like cinnamon...

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: (nodding sagely) Of course. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: AIDAN
dialogues.text: Don't underestimate the novelty gift market. Think about it... instead of giving that token slutty friend a ten-inch purple dildo for her birthday, you hook her up with "The SLUT." Everyone has a laugh and the implication that she'll probably use it someday remains. What do you say? Are you down?

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: I'm down with getting you on some sort of medication.

dialogues.speaker: AIDAN
dialogues.text: OK...fine...be cynical...just remember at some point in history two people had a conversation just like this about the light bulb. One of them went on to fame and fortune and the other one probably went to work at Mickey D's or something.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Or Denny's. Denny's was big in the 19th century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TINTED TOWN CAR stops in-front of a funky corner browns where Caroline waits in a plaid jumper on the front steps THE DRIVER opens the back door of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline in the cavernous backseat alone. Her pink knapsa her only company. The Town Car stops at a crosswalk for a GROUP OF CHILDREN jeans and tee- shirts on their way to a local Public Scho Caroline sees them through the tinted glass. They couldn' see her even if they wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an unfortunate reality but a reality nonetheless ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TYLER sits in the back of the room. Their PROFESSOR addre the few students paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in the wake of terrorist attacks these insurance company actuaries are provided a unique opportunity to raise premiums and profits to protect against events that will likely never occur again... One girl, a focused brunette with beautiful eyes, takes n relentlessly. She is present, absorbing the material. She raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that also an ethical question? Tyler shoots her a glance. He takes in her lovely face, h casual dress, and the CHARM BRACELET with its four leaf clovers. WE REALIZE this is Alicia "Ally" Craig, now 19. Tyler grimaces at the question and its implications of ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Alice in Wonderland statue where KIDS climb all ov the faded bronze mushroom caps and characters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The statue is warm, the bronze absorbing the late spring Tyler is perched on the Mad Hatter, his face turned towar the sun while Caroline hides with the dormouse. Tyler lights a cigarette. AN UPTIGHT MOMMY glares at him. UPTIGHT MOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we make this a non- smoking statue? CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emerging) Yeah, Tyler . Why don't we make this a non-smoking statue? He makes a face. CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised you'd quit... TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna get emphysema and then you're gonna have to drag an oxygen tank with you everywhere... TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that would be the worst part about having emphysema? CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everywhere you go, Tyler. Even the bathroom. Tyler takes a final drag. Tosses it on the ground. CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think Dad doesn't wanna...like, listen to me? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad loves you. Caroline gives him a look. CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? You can love someone and not want to spend any time with them. Caroline is climbing around Alice. Her hands on Alice's h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got that right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom loves Aunt Sara. But at Christmas, last year, she wouldn't let Les leave them in a room together 'cause she said there would be a "yule tide homicide."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because Aunt Sara drinks... You don't drink, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why would anyone wanna avoid you? Caroline shrugs, not convinced. A silent moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael used to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He did. But Michael was 21. All 21 year olds drink because it's new and exciting. Aunt Sara drinks because she wishes she was 21. A shared smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're 21. Tyler's smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler on a rolling ladder, shuffling books around. Aidan the floor, eating two pieces of pizza, folded down the middle, at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Atlantic City for your birthday this year? Get a suite. Couple of ladies. You could call Toothbrush Girl, what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'd rather be sodomized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's your day. He gestures to the shelves. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point? How do you know where anything is in this place, anyway? There's like... AIDAN/TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Eight Miles of Books!" TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't expect you to appreciate this, but the schematic for this particular shelf is authors who were sleeping together... AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And ended up dead or in prison. Beat. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is why chicks dig you. Tyler laughs. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously. They like this freaky poetic crap. I ran into Megan yesterday. She's bartending at Don Hill's tonight. She wants us to stop by. She practically begged me. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh. Aidan, visibly frustrated with Tyler's reluctance, grabs rolling ladder and pushes Tyler into the Romance novels. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey nothing. You've been a ghost the past couple weeks. You never wanna go out. I'm feeling unappreciated here. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIDAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't deal with this brooding introvert shit anymore man. I'm ready to set up an intervention. A silent moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize interventions typically discourage binge drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One drink. Come out for one drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the last time you had one drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hip venue on Greenwich Street. Deejay. Music pumping. Aidan and Tyler make their way through the crowd to a congested bar where the CUTE BARTENDER is swamped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Megan! She ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look great! Can I get two Heinekens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do. Not. Speak. Tyler snorts with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she mad at me or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no. Girls are like that when they're way into you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Two nubile young GIRLS approach Aidan. Tap his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aidan flashes a winning smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you take a picture for us? She holds out her camera. Aidan hesitates, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure... The girls pose. Aidan takes the camera. Turns it around. Extends it. Smiles. And promptly SNAPS A PICTURE OF HIMSE He casually returns the camera to the confused young woma Megan returns and practically flings the beers at Aidan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. You've met my roommate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you die. Tyler laughs his ass off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's all over you. Cheers. They clink bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler and Aidan stand with the girls from Aidan's photo opportunity. All are thoroughly intoxicated. There is a k of CLUB GOERS halfway down the block, drinking and having fine time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love this street. I love this city. Where are you guys from, again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miami. Miami, Barcelona, Rio. New York is it, man. God broke the mold when he made this city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever actually been to any of those places? AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your point? There's a gust of wind. Aidan's girl shivers. She's weari tiny dress. AIDAN'S GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing? I'm freezing. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulda worn a jacket. Like me. O/S WE HEAR: a beer bottle crashing on the ground, and fr far away a ghostly, plaintive girl's voice disappearing i the night... VOICE O/S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael...Mi-i-chael! Tyler turns towards the sound. It's as if he's trying to a train in the distance. His hand goes to his pocket and fishes out his pack of cigarettes. AIDAN'S GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Aidan) Asshole. She walks away, looking back at her friend, annoyed. AIDAN'S GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coming? Tyler's Girl looks at Tyler, who is still preoccupied. TYLER'S GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to her friend) Hold on, Lauren. The girls step away. Tyler's Girl appears to be trying to convince her friend to stay. Aidan watches them, hopefull Tyler isn't watching them. He's watching two cool looking MUSICIANS, crossing the street with the LIGHT, carrying S EQUIPMENT. A quartet of NEANDERTHALS pulls up at the light in front them in a car, aggressive music playing. The Neanderthal the wheel has the brilliant idea to rev his engine and lu the car forward, startling the musicians, toying with the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSICIAN #1 glares, but gives no further response, he jus wants to get across the street. The Neanderthal revs and lurches again. MUSICIAN #2 slams his hand on the hood of the car. MUSICIAN#2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem? NEANDERTHAL DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My problem? Keep your hands off my car, asshole. MUSICIAN#2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow it out your ass, Guido. MUSICIAN#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to Long Island. The car's four doors open, and the Neanderthals lope to t front of the car. The driver is holding a mini baseball b at his side. NEANDERTHAL DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from Queens, faggot A Neanderthal shoves one of the musicians, and the driver starts wailing on the other with the bat. Tyler watches a the Neanderthals overpower them. The altercation has turn into a full on assault. The Musicians are getting stomped into the pavement. TYLER'S GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we were thinking we could go... Tyler walks right past the girl without even looking at h AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) God damn it. Aidan runs off after Tyler. Tyler jumps fully into the thick of it, swinging, grabbin the beefiest Neanderthal in a choke hold and pounding the guy's face. He fights like a pit bull. Not feeling, not stopping. Aidan gets punched in the face. Tyler elbows the nose of guy who punched Aidan and it spurts blood. Then someone h Tyler in the gut, and he doubles over and takes a knee to chin. The musicians get back to their feet and fight back It's a brawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aidan's girl is screaming for the cops. Tyler's girl, following the instincts of the inebriated, has teetered n enough to the brawl to imperil herself. A Neanderthal swings at Aidan and misses, grazing the gir She jerks away in her high heels and crashes to the pavem splitting her lip on impact. Tyler head butts the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AMBULANCE and TWO E.M.T.'S are on site. THE COMBATANTS from the brawl are lined up on the curb. SERGEANT JAMES CRAIG, a little older and heavier than whe first met him at the train station, is standing with the Girl, who is a mess. Her nose bloody, her dress torn. Craig shields the Girl with his body, listening carefully her and her friend as the two girls GESTURE ANGRILY at th Neanderthals. Craig's eyes flicker in the same direction. Craig's PARTNER, LEO, AFRICAN AMERICAN, a few years young is on the radio to Dispatch. Craig snaps his fingers at one of the E.M.T.'s and receiv blanket, which he carefully wraps around the girl. Then, his partner, indicating Tyler and Aidan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut those two loose. Leo puts down the handset and uncuffs the guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a walk. Tyler takes a beat, looking at the lineup. Aidan, rubbing wrists, gestures "Let's go". Tyler looks at the bloodied and... Craig, going through the pockets of Neanderthal #1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything in here that's going to stab me, Einstein? Craig finds a packet, or a vial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. You like to get high and hit women?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aidan gives Tyler's elbow a gentle tug. Tyler's caught up the action. NEANDERTHAL#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know the bitch. Rage flickers across Craig's face. Craig moves down the line to one of the musicians, going through their pockets. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you two? Tyler, compelled, drawing closer to the action. MUSICIAN#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't us, man! NEANDERTHAL#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That cocksucker kicked my car! CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, genius. MUSICIAN#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Neanderthal) Eat shit, pencil dick. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. That's it. Everybody goes downtown. Tyler steps forward, interrupting... TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't them. Aidan, who has been edging away, jerks around to his frie AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Tyler... LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, to the guys) Take a walk, I said. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Craig, big angry Irish cop, turns to Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't do anything. They didn't start this. Those assholes did. Why do these guys have to go downtown? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you still doing here? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit. It was those gorillas who started this. Craig moves slowly toward Tyler and starts going through Tyler's pockets, roughly. He finds his wallet. Starts rif through. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Roth. What makes you think I give a shit? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a police officer. You're supposed to. What the hell? Craig looks from the guy he was frisking t Tyler's girl, wrapped in a blanket. She spits blood. He t a bit to Tyler. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a great relief to me, Mr. Roth, to know that you're on top of the situation. Now go the fuck home. He turns back to work. Tyler looks briefly at Aidan. Aidan looks desperate "Plea Let's get out of here!" Tyler TOUCHES CRAIG'S ELBOW. Aidan's jaw drops. Leo takes several silent steps in. Cra looks at his own elbow then looks at Tyler. The kid must out of his mind. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you do your job? SLAM. Craig takes Tyler's legs out, driving his face into pavement, a GASH opens above Tyler's LEFT EYE. Tyler lies there dazed and disoriented as Craig, with one knee on Tyler's neck, crushes his face into the ground. He slaps cuffs on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows what time it is. A lovely ASSORTMENT OF PERPETRATORS, Tyler and the musicians are in lockup. Everybody looks like shit. Tyler sits on a bench in the holding cell, looking quite relaxed. The lock up door slides open and Aidan is returned to the perch. The ESCORTING OFFICER shouts across the din to Tyl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can have your call now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. The door slides shut behind Aidan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good? Thank God you're good. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to do? What did you want from that cop guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a messed up situation. Those guys... He cups his hands to make a megaphone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Are pussies! From Off Screen a chorus of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faggot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy-ass faggot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fag!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no justice in that situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No justice. Okay, Green Hornet ... Lantern ... Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIDAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may not be actually matriculating in school, you may be having a nice time by yourself lurking in the stacks of your book store, but I actually plan on graduating, and having a career and a wife and a girlfriend and a divorce and a mid-life stalking episode and erectile dysfunction, and I will thank you to keep your complexes and nihilistic bullshit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you just say "nihilistic"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I got it off a cereal box. Tyler smiles. The Escorting Officer returns with a white male LAWYER wearing a two thousand dollar suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth, Brewer. Tyler glares at Aidan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I called your dad's office. Sue me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally, with a cup of coffee, is on the house phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when would that be available?...No, that's sooner than I'd thought. And is there any kind of deposit?.. Okay. Craig comes in through the kitchen door, takes off his ja and starts washing his hands at the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you back. Thanks. Ally hangs up. Makes a quick appraisal of her dad. He has little blood on his cuff. He splashes his face with water

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On automatic pilot, Ally flips on the toaster, pours some coffee into a Sesame Street Mug, pours in a measured dose brown sugar from the dispenser, then flips open a bottle Aspirin and deposits two of the tablets into the mug. She packs up her back pack with school stuff as Craig gul his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you tell me you were going to do when things got tight? The toaster dings. She extracts an English muffin and squeezes honey from a bottle shaped like a bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. I'm breathing right now. Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lady from student housing. We talked about it. Remember? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Ally grabs her sweatshirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lippman is going to drive me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drive you. She flounces out the door, holding her own cup of coffee the English Muffin. Craig dries his hands, grabs his jack and a set of keys from the counter. 19   EXT. DRIVEWAY. Outside their red-brick row house at the end of a block o red-brick row houses. Ally has her mug on the roof of the car and is searching through her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig comes around the driver's side and slides Ally her across the roof. She drops them in her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lippman said she'd do it. Craig is in the driver's seat, waiting. Ally grabs her co mug and gets into the passenger seat. She hands him his English muffin, which he holds in his mouth as he starts car. She flips down the visor and checks her very light eye makeup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're exhausted. When you have a stroke I'm going to abandon you on a park bench. They start to back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This drive is too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler and his messed up face on his feet in the waiting a English Club chairs, green baize on the walls. A RECEPTIO types away across the room. Tyler takes out a cigarette. Lights it. Draws the ire of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you can't smoke in here. Tyler looks down at a heavy crystal ash tray on the coffe table in front of him. It's clearly never been used.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's with the ash tray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It completes the room. Tyler takes a long drag, grinding out the ember on the pristine surface. He smiles a charming smile at the aggravated woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANINE, Charles' long time assistant, late forties, kind eyes, watches Tyler from the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's ready for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler follows Janine down the corridor. She looks him up down, doesn't like what she sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too skinny. And you smell like french fries and cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to lie? Tyler smiles, he likes that she doesn't lie. Janine scrol through a Palm Pilot as she walks. They approach the doub doors to Charles' office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try not to give him a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Tyler bangs through the doors. Janine grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of floor-to-ceiling windows blocked by vertical bli Sunlight glows behind them. There's a lot of leather, bra and rich wood, breathing power. There's a flat screen computer, but no personal effects anywhere. Charles sits at his massive desk. As Tyler enters, Charle registers his injuries. A flicker of something over Charl face. Tyler stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to see how much it costs, because I'm giving you the money back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much what costs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That lawyer. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. That lawyer, Tyler, costs 450 dollars an hour. In spite of himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to make sure you understood it wasn't me who called you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. You could do worse than have a father who bails you out of jail

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be bailed out of anything. Charles looks at his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get an invoice from Janine. Tyler leaves, slamming the door behind him. 23   INT. HALLWAY. Tyler stops, catching himself, realizing the emptiness of gesture. He looks up and sees Janine looking at him. 24   INT. WALL STREET COFFEE SHOP -- AFTER. Tyler in the same booth, surrounded by a commotion of businessmen and women. He's writing in his Journal, his f tapping fast. We see the very act of writing eases him, loosening his strangled grip on the pen, slowing down the manic rhythm of his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just after three, Caroline emerges from school in a CLUSTER OF 6TH GRADE GIRLS. One of them dips her head tow Caroline's ear, as if to share a secret. Whatever she say makes Caroline's face crumble, almost to tears, and the g snicker. Tyler hops from his perch on a parked car. His bike leans a fire hydrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Caroline)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. He looks at the girls, sizing them up, and flicks his cigarette to the sidewalk, cool as hell. The girls have a group swoon. He takes Caroline by the elbow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse us, we're due in surgery. He gets his bike and leads her down the block, towards Fi Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrible threshing accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so retarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mock the afflicted. Here, I brought you something. He hands her the book of Myths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was my favorite book ever. Michael had it and he hit me over the head with it until I read it. Its about all these God and Goddesses who spend all of their time being jealous and petty and otherwise acting like human beings. The illustrations are amazing. Caroline opens the book carefully and has a peek. She smi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh. These are cool. Thanks! Where are we meeting mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guggenheim. What's up with those girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just...they think I'm weird. Sometimes I sort of space out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're drawing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Other times too. Madamoiselle Fleischman had to snap her fingers at me a lot today. And everybody laughed and they all think I'm a freak of nature. Caroline takes a brief glance over her shoulder, towards school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Je m'appelle "Freak of Nature." Caroline smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mon dieu, mon soeurette! Je m'appelle "Freak of Nature". Sacre Bleu. French Toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to tell mom about your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finally found something I'm good at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aidan appears to have cornered a PROFESSOR on her way in out of the building. The woman looks tired, annoyed, like just wants to go. Aidan talks fast, even faster than usua

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I know by every numerical measurement I didn't pass but what I was hoping was that maybe you give me a grade on my trying to pass. My commitment to effort. My commitment to commitment...Since the semester is nearly at it's terminus. Craig's car rolls to a stop just in front of the flags. A gives him a kiss on the cheek. She gets out, and walks up stairs, right past Aidan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean... uh... life's only about what we put into it. It's about people. And what they put into it. And I'm -- ah, screw it. Aidan runs off leaving the befuddled professor on the ste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler, again with the guitar. Aidan enters, excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop... The cop who busted your face all up. He's got a daughter. And she's hot! I smell revenge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revenge. What do you want me to do, kidnap her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You introduce yourself...go on a few dates...be your charming, gentlemanly self... And then, flip the script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw her brains out and make her call you daddy. Steal her underwear and sell it on ebay. Put her in Clown Shoes, take lewd photos and post them on her high school's home page. I don't know. Be creative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be incarcerated on general principle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. What happened to you was very emasculating. Tell me you don't want to get that asshole and I'll drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to get that asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just meet her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to meet her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're meeting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not meeting her.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COFFEE SHOP. WASHINGTON SQUARE PARK.- DAY
dialogues.text: A Student Hangout. The place is bustling. Numerous NYU STUDENTS move, sit, eat, lounge. Aidan scans the crowd. T stands beside him looking far less enthusiastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is one of those moments I'm already regretting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was here yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to say to this girl? "Hey doll face, your dad trampled all over my civil liberties, wanna make out?" AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well don't call her doll face. Ally enters. She wears a big sweatshirt. Aidan spots her. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. The brunette. Tyler watches her settle into a couch with a big cup of coffee. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know her. I mean, I don't know her, but, I've seen her. She's in my global politics class. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go! Something to open with. Now get over there. Tyler sighs, begins toward Ally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shazam! Tyler glares. Aidan gives a big thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Ally briefly looks up from her book. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Tyler Roth. I was wondering if I could bother you for a minute? He gives her a charming smile. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're already bothering me. Beat. The smile usually works. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I'm doing kind of a sociological experiment...I was hoping you could help me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally looks at him, a little wearily, holding her place in book. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, kidding me? Tyler is genuinely taken aback. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I... may I ask your name? ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anonymous. It's Greek. It means "you don't have a shot". A surprised laugh escapes from Tyler. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Anonymous, do you see the guy across the room, pretending to read a text book, looking in this general direction? Aidan holds a MATH TEXTBOOK at an awkward angle to mask h obvious interest in Ally and Tyler's conversation. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subtle. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have this theory that an objective third-party, having no prior contact, would be able to determine how much of an asshole he is just by looking at him. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my roommate. And I've witnessed so many glaring examples of assaholic behavior that I'm biased as a subject, but I'm convinced that he has an aura, that people can actually perceive. So, just take a good long look. And tell me what you think? She looks at Aidan, briefly, who shifts to avoid her gaze Then she takes a peek at Tyler's profile. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else do you plan on asking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one here. The parameters called only to sample attractive women in their early twenties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm nineteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In their late teens. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look, you typically get something for participating in these things and I've run out of those big foam fingers, so I was thinking maybe I could take you out some night? She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you could just go out with me on the off chance we'd have an interesting conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't date sociology majors... they're a rowdy bunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed they are. Lucky for you, I'm undecided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything. Tyler smiles. Ally tries to hide a smile. She closes her and extends her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Ally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline in art class amongst a sea of green plaid. The g work in relative silence, drawing, painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ART TEACHER walks amongst them looking over their shoulders, sees a lot of amateur art work, then she comes upon Caroline and stops. The teacher finds herself captiv by ... A COMIC PORTRAIT of Diane and Les kissing in the doorway their brownstone. Diane has a bit of a manic smile and Le half her size. Caroline notices her teacher staring. She doesn't like it shifts to block her view. The teacher gently eases her ba Smiles softly. Caroline smiles back as her teacher moves across the room Caroline has just put her pencil back to paper when... The BITCHY GIRLS we've seen before start whispering and smirking. One of them mouths...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss ass freak. Caroline's smile shrinks away and she goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CRAIG FAMILY HOME ALLY'S BEDROOM-- NEXT EVENING
dialogues.text: Ally in sweat pants, an ancient tee-shirt, her hair in a Scrunchie, eating Mallomars from the bag and reading. Craig yells from the bottom of the stairs. He carries a b from a video store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be mad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, we've seen freaking Erin Brockovich twice already. You always cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's embarrassing. Her cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. It's Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to stand me up. I can feel it in my bones. I'll be devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I...I was just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just sitting around in your pajamas watching T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm not watching T.V. I'm just...getting dressed. She wipes her hands on her sweats, smearing them with chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm going to meet you at the place at..what time again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right...yes. Eight...okay. She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. She whips the Scrunchie out of her hair and heads for the bathroom. 32   INT.CRAIG HOUSE. KITCHEN. Ally comes down the stairs, putting on her earrings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig looks at Ally, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're a trained investigator. She is moving quickly, grabbing her bag, her wallet. Crai tosses her keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you going with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy from school. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't asking for permission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. (more gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good time. Here's cab fare. He peels off a couple of twenties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I wait up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad. Craig puts his hands in the air in surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hole in the wall Lower East Side Thai restaurant. Tyler Ally sit together perusing menus. A WAITER approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the waiter) What desserts do you have? WAITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dessert special fried bananas a la mode. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, I'll have that. A glass of skim milk. Then the mussels, please. Tyler and the Waiter share a look. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pad Thai and a Sapporo. Thanks. The Waiter takes the menus. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my dessert first. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a political statement? A medical condition? ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't see the point in waiting for something I know I want and am going to have. What if I die eating my mussels? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that probable? ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible. If an embolism burst or an asteroid hit the restaurant, I'd die without having eaten the thing I wanted most. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the odds are, I mean... ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I'll tell you what, you guarantee me. Swear to me on your eternal soul that I'll make it through my entrГ©e. And I'll wait. Tyler goes to answer. Ally holds up a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before you answer, keep in mind, if I die, you'll have to live the rest of your life knowing that you not only lied to me, but denied me my last indulgence. My last wish. Are you prepared to shoulder that kind of responsibility to prove a point? Tyler thinks about it. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I'll share.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LEMONGRASS GRILL-- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Tyler and Ally exit out onto the street. Tyler immediatel takes out his cigarettes, his lighter, then he notices... Ally looking at him disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Tyler takes the cue puts the packet and lighter away. A b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a nice time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a nice time or you're having a nice time? Ally considers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if you're having one, why rush to end it?

dialogues.speaker: AFTER
dialogues.text: They approach a CARNIVAL GAME, one those ubiquitous basketball tosses. THE ATTENDANT badgers passersby to tes their luck. GIANT STUFFED ANIMALS hang all around it. Tyler pays the Attendant, gets the basketballs. Tosses on two, the third, then nothing. Game over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I tell you I'm Caucasian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently. Tyler pays again, wipes out again. Game over. Tyler pays again. Loses again. He's visibly frustrated now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we just stroll while I feed you ice cream with fireworks in the background?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. If I stop, he wins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, the attendant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the frigging Giant Panda. Tyler hands the ATTENDANT another dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally carries a GIANT PANDA under her arm. Tyler walking beside her with a self-satisfied smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're smiling about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paying off the attendant is not winning... It's cheating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just paid a premium to cut out the middle man. That's innovation. That's free market enterprising. That's what made America great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aha. By the way, what happened to your eye? Tyler touches the bandage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's nothing, just a bar fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How butch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm practically a pirate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Captain Morgan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got some serious timing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll walk you to the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler is just hailing her a taxi. He stands there holding door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Beat. Tyler leans in to kiss her. Ally turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight. Not never... just... not tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We goin' or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Turn on the meter. Tyler respectfully leans back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So dessert before dinner for fear of death by rogue asteroid... yes. Kissing guy you're obviously attracted to before driving off into the unknown New York night... no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally considers. She gives him a quick but tender kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really weird. She gets in the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the driver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to Queens and I don't wanna hear about it. Off she goes in the taxi. Tyler watches her go. 38   EXT. PRIVATE SCHOOL. THE LAST DAY OF SCHOOL. Caroline exiting with the crowd. One of the Bitchy girls shoulder checks her from behind as she passes. Tyler, wai on his perch, catches it, walks up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy end of sixth grade!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHILDREN climbing all over the bronze statue. Caroline am them. She sits on a mushroom cap, letting her legs dangle Tyler watches her from their usual bench, his bike leanin next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have me in this art program summer thing at Pratt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very prestigious due to my artistic greatness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pretend. I know you're proud. You should be. Caroline allows herself a tiny grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's, like, a thing... TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thing? CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepish) A show where you show what you've done and stuff. Will you come? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me check my book. Abso-freaking- lutely. I'm camping out. I'm sleeping there the night before. Caroline is secretly thrilled. CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so retarded. Mom's been hyperventilating with joy. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'm sure Les was... TYLER/CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Really supportive"! CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your school's over, right? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's over. Did Mom and Les get the beach house again? CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. What are we going to do for your birthday? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we have a party? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little one? At Mom's? With Aidan. I'll make Mom behave. No crying. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like that's possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline smiles.

dialogues.speaker: INT. RAILROAD FLAT-- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ally explores Tyler's living room with a tumbler of wine. It's in a state of medium disarray. He clocks her looking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But we have coasters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't do coasters till the third date. She looks over his posters, pictures, etc. Tyler scans a stack of CDs, he selects Radiohead's KID A, puts it in. T hypnotic first track fills the room. Ally comes across a FRAMED PHOTO of a band on stage. The guitarist looks like Tyler with long hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Michael. My brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks like you... or you look like him. Does he play around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not any more. Ally notices the old guitar in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It depends who you ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I asked anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd say no. I try but it turns out you need talent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what talents do you actually have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falconry. I come from a long line of falconers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lot of money in that. Tyler smiles. He's actually a hair nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well there is one thing... Tyler walks to the kitchen counter where a cleaned and polished COVERED CAKE STAND sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our appetizer. Tyler lifts off the cover to reveal a GERMAN CHOCOLATE CA He's written a message in the icing: "In Case Of Ast-- an then a piece has been crudely cut out. Ally's surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It used to say "In Case Of Asteroid" but I took a shower and Aidan got high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally and Tyler stand in front of a sink full of dirty dis up to their elbows in soapy water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what kind of grade did you end up with from Vogelstein?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't actually get grades. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not technically enrolled. I worked out an auditing thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. And The Strand is not a significant career choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the books. He indicates the dishes. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to help me, you know. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the rate you're going, dish washing is going to be your life's vocation. I can say I knew you when. He flicks a bit of water on her shirt. Ally takes a beat. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the playful, you get me all wet part? Right? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horsing around) You make it sound so cheap. Ally's not having it. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is cheap. I've seen this scene a hundred times. Tyler's a little confused. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't... ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what never happens in this scene, Tyler-who-doesn't-really-go- to-school? Tyler-who-doesn't-really care-about-his-job? Tyler blinks helplessly. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This. An entire enormous pot of pasta water up ended on the hos Bits of spaghetti cling to him, tiny tomatoes and zucchin his shoulders like little barnacles. He sputters and gasp and blinks. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that usually never happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She calmly goes back to washing dishes. Beat. Spaghetti guy stares at her. She gives it right back to him, 100% New York City. Beat. In one move Tyler slings Ally over his shoulder. She grun unglamorously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler bursts through the bathroom door. Ally over his shoulder. Never one to waste a moment, she uses the opportunity to check out what's in his wallet. He turns o the shower. She has his drivers licence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. Your middle name is Keats? Your parents are pretentious as hell. Tyler turns on the shower and tosses Ally into the water. dances to avoid the stream. Ally grabs the portable showe head and turns it at him. Tyler jumps into the tub to avoid the spray. They wrestle the shower head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather eat monkeys. This cracks Tyler up. He stops struggling for the shower gasps a little with laughter, putting up his hands in surrender. Ally stands there, holding the shower head, giggling. They lock eyes for a moment. The air is charged. Ally spritzes him in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I surrender! Oh my God, you're relentless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides down the wall until he's sitting in the tub, Al follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victory at all costs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler and Ally lie side-by-side, drenched. Their feet han over the edge of the tub. Tyler reaches into his pocket a removes a dripping cigarette packet. He squeezes out wate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now... I'm furious. He tosses them in a waste basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should quit anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Why? Are cigarettes like bad for you or something? Ally playfully slaps him. She notices the tip of Tyler's TATTOO peeking out of his undershirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a tattoo? Let me see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. It's very bad ass. All that ritualistic scarring. Tyler peels the soaked garment off his back as Ally offer polite applause. Michael's name becomes clear. Ally takes long look. She sees Tyler's not smiling anymore. She gets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I didn't... I didn't realize. She looks at him. Asking with out asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed himself. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he was 21. He had just started working for my father. Ally is gently picking spaghetti and tomatoes off Tyler. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he was a musician. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was. But he wasn't making a living doing music and my father's a very compelling guy. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine too. Ally looks away for a moment. Tucks a curl behind her ear Then they look at each other. Ally opens her mouth to spe Aidan bursts in. He's drunk, loud, wearing an Irish Flag a cape. He carries a bottle of whiskey and a can of Guinn AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, you're not naked. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not Irish. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T, What happened in the kitchen? It looks like somebody's water broke. (notices Ally) Hi. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally, Aidan... Aidan, Ally. Aidan takes Ally's hand. Kisses it. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't feel bad that you're more attracted to me than you are to him it happens to all of them. Ally looks at Aidan closely, trying to figure out where s knows him from, it dawns on her. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! You're the assaholic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I-- (realizes what she said)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. What? Tyler and Ally laugh. Aidan's too drunk to care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, you two. Up. Dressed. Let's go. "Around The World" party on the third floor... a lot of ugly but a lot more alcohol. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, I would, I'd love to, but I've gotta get home, my dad's waiting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally. Ally. Listen to me, young lady. One drink. From any country. I'll even put France on the table. One drink. Your choice. And we're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tyler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Aidan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocent shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally VOMITS in their toilet. Tyler holds her hair back. A appears in the doorway still wearing that flag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how we doin'? Ally tries to speak, all we hear is a series of groans. T she dry heaves again. Tyler shoots Aidan a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What do you want me to say? That I'm sorry? You want me to say I"m sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIDAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to apologize for showing a nice girl a good time? Is that it? Tyler just looks at him. Aidan considers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler... Tyler kneels down. Ally pushes her purse at him, she look like she's about to pass out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, need, you... to call... my dad. Tyler and Aidan share a look. Aidan shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. OK. Sure. Tyler pulls out her cellphone - the battery is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your phone's dead. Just tell me the number and I'll call him... Tyler turns around to find Ally passed out on the floor. tries to gently nudge her awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally? Ally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Ally's a good kid, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedside clock reads 3:47. Craig is on the phone while searching through Ally's desk drawers. For anything. He f a note book with a red cover and starts flipping through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...She was supposed to be back. She's not back ... call Ted Proferes ... and what's his face in the 9th...and call me back. Just do it, Leo! Craig hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. He picks it up again and starts dialing, still flipping through the notebook.

dialogues.speaker: INT TYLER'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Ally wakes up alone in Tyler's bed, hung over, confused, trying to put the pieces together, then she sees the cloc And a wave of panic washes over her as she jumps out of b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...oh God oh God oh God oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler sleeps on the couch using Aidan's Irish Flag as a blanket. Ally comes in pulling on her shoes. Tyler stirs time to see her run out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig sits at the table, dialing someone, anyone. Ally enters, drops her keys on the counter. Her father doesn't look at her as she pours herself a coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm sorry. I fell asleep... Craig squeezes honey into his coffee, practically strangl the Bear. Not looking at her. Ally notices the red notebook on the kitchen table next t the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You turned your phone off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot to charge it. It dawns on her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's mine. From my desk. Craig says nothing. Just stirs his coffee. Ally is furiou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were gone all night. I was trying to get some information. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you go through my stuff like I'm a suspect? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then stop acting like one. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the matter with you, Dad? You have no respect for me and the way I'm feeling, my privacy. We talked about this! You're totally paranoid... CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch your mouth! ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't do anything. You don't go anywhere except work. You have no life. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life is right here! In this house. The same place as yours. But you're spitting all over it. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Dad! I went on a date! CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I smell alcohol... Right back at him. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I. Beat. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad... CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: THIS IS MY HOUSE
dialogues.text: ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK! He hits her, hard, open hand, from across the widt his body. Ally is knocked off balance and hits her head o the cabinets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally! His face is contorted with panic and shame. Ally's disoriented. Her ears are ringing. Her lip is spli knot is starting to form where she hit her head. She straightens herself up and stares at her dad like she no idea who he is. Beat. Craig tries to envelop her. With a guttural snarl she pus him away, getting a little bit of blood on his shirt. She scrambles up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunshine beats down on a little make-shift rooftop hideaw a few old beach chairs, a stereo, a weight bench. Aidan w out with an old set of dumb bells. Tyler sits on a beach chair, trying again with the guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...So? She just left? No good bye? Tyler nods, strumming like he's wearing boxing gloves. Ai finishes up a set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she heard you play the guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the one dumping Jello shots down her throat. You almost killed her. Aidan lies down to do the bench press... there's a lot of weight on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are sins of omission and sins of commission, my friend. I've dealt with mine and I've forgiven myself... you should do the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aidan lifts. It's too heavy and falls to his chest. Tyler forgoes his spotting duty, lets him struggle. Aidan strai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...little help, T... little help, little help, lotta help... TYLER?! Tyler blows three perfect smoke rings. Finally he puts do the guitar and helps get the bar up. Aidan panting, rubbi his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penance. I have to get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler and Aidan come into their apartment, Aidan still rubbing his chest. Ally is standing there in the middle o the living area. A packed bag at her feet, her face a mes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know where else to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aidan sits on the couch still in his gym clothes drinking protein shake out of a blender. Tyler comes out of his bedroom gently closing the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's she doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pretty shaken up. Tyler takes a seat beside him. Takes out a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've really got to fix that dead bolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bad. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be. You think she'll sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize if she had had the

dialogues.speaker: S.L.U.T
dialogues.text: If looks could kill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too soon? A silent moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told her she could stay here... Are you alright with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as she needs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler has just finished making up the ratty sofa as a bed Ally appears from the bedroom, framed by the open door. S has slept in one of Tyler's button down shirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're up. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you anything? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be out here if you need me. Beat. Ally takes off the shirt and lets it fall. She stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We interrupt Ally and Tyler in the throes of passion. Tyl sits on the edge of the bed. Ally is on top. She kisses h neck. Suddenly, Tyler throws her to the bed. He takes control. Ally's momentarily taken aback, but doesn't stop him. There's noticeable aggression to their love-making.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the midst of everything, the pair slow almost to stopp a caesura. They stare into each other in a moment of surp and recognition. Then again. Young, hungry, aggressive.

dialogues.speaker: TIME LAPSE
dialogues.text: They lie, eyes closed, almost asleep, entwined with each other. Tyler gives a little sound of contentment. Ally, i her own haze, reaches for him, her hair all over the plac Eyes still closed they fumble for each other, starting, i this dream state, to make love all over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
