dialogues.text: The sheets have been torn loose from the mattress. Ally l asleep, curled in the comforter. Tyler lies awake beside he smokes a cigarette and watches the sky just starting t brighten. Tyler gets out of bed. Grabs his journal. A NOTE propped up next to the bed: "Please don't leave. I be back."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler locking his bike outside the coffee shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is empty. A few early RISERS get coffee to go. He sits in the same booth, his journal held open by the binder clip. He writes, a bag of Bialys next to him. Janine enters. Orders two coffees. She sees Tyler, smiles She picks up her coffees and approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you still come down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler looks up, grins, nods to her coffees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so far. I can't believe you still get his coffee... three sugars, no milk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old habits. You're not writing anything bad about me, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta run. Early meetings. Janine turns to go, remembers something, turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I probably won't see you before Saturday so...happy birthday. Tyler nods, tries to smile. Janine glances back as she go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be sure to tell your father that you said hello. Tyler nods sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler returns with breakfast. From Aidan's room, a pathet croak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bialy. Tyler tosses him a Bialy like he's tossing fish to a seal Ally lies on the couch. Curled in a blanket. A cup of hot in hand. She sips it. It stings her lip a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Tyler sits. She shifts and curls next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Tyler pulls his JOURNAL from his pocket. Hands it to her. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a coffee shop. I brought you a Bialy. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York is full of coffee shops. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one was our place... Michael's and mine. We had breakfast there all the time ... Maybe not as many times as I think we did. But enough times. Anyway we ate there that morning. It was the last place I saw him. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. So you go there to write? To him? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Sometimes. I don't know. But I guess I wanted to tell him about you. Ally is moved, you can see it in her eyes, but she choose not to overdo it. She flips through the journal. She hand back to him. Then out of nowhere. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom was murdered eight years ago. The same year your brother died. Tyler is stunned. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to say anything, I know you're sorry. Everyone's always sorry, you know? He does. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just, I need you to know that, my dad, he's not an evil guy. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALLY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to think that because I'm here he's some kind of belligerent psychotic, he's not...I don't know, it's just recently, he seems really... She looks at Tyler's face. His eyes are so patient. Ally tears up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wounded? Our house is like the recovery room, or the critical care unit or something. Tyler strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel like that, though. I feel like I'm getting stronger and like I'm leaving him behind to swim in it all by himself. She is weeping. Tyler pulls her to him doing the best he Holding her and kissing her hair. 58   INT. SIXTH PRECINCT -- 2 DAYS LATER. Sergeant Craig standing with a ROOKIE OFFICER, berating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something, Matthews, do you like paperwork?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. Craig is working up a head of steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither. Nobody likes paperwork. But paperwork keeps our ship afloat. Paperwork makes it possible for me to keep track of all the scumbags. But I can't do that if newbies like you are incapable of remembering standard filing... Leo interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig snaps his head around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What? Leo gestures to speak privately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally called Sharon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said to tell you, she's with friends, and she's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all? His partner nods. Craig looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jim. Listen, why don't you come over this weekend? We'll get the grill going. Sharon wants to see you. We can have some people, nice people...You can circulate a little...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo, no. Stop. Craig goes back to his desk. Leo looks after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aidan sits in the living room, trying to assemble an IKEA television stand. A joint smolders in the ashtray. The BU rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aidan goes to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aidan, it's Diane. He blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey Diane. He throws down the keys, then yells towards the roof...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T! It's your mom. With Diane's knock the door swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Diane. He gives her a kiss on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really have to fix that door. I'm so sorry to just show up. I called but your phone was busy. Aidan looks and realizes that the phone is indeed off the hook, as just the handset, wrapped in duct tape, is visib on top of the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. Come on in. Tyler and Ally enter the apartment through the fire escap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I'm so sorry honey. I tried to call but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Mom, this is Ally. Ally, this is my mom, Diane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Nice to meet you. Diane is thrilled. She has a huge mom grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally. It's lovely to met you. Just lovely. Diane is pumping Ally's hand like she's drilling for oil. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Mom. Can I get you something? She navigates the IKEA carnage and sits on the sofa, the joint smoldering in the ashtray in front of her. Aidan ev the gent, removes the ashtray to the window ledge. DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Aidan, would you bring back that spliff, please? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh..okay. Tyler looks completely befuddled. Aidan passes Diane the joint. She takes a deep hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's work, Diane? DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ... (BIG exhale) I just found housing for a family that had been in shelters for three weeks. So that's good. On the other hand, I have six other families. The women measure each other. DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Tyler, I wanted to talk to you. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Aidan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Diane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to drag Aidan out the window, back up the fire escape, but he makes a brief detour. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't freaking bogart that joint, Diane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. She hands it back to him and Aidan and Ally climb away. Tyler sits next to his mom and lights a cigarette. DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, first, your sister is all excited about your birthday at the house. I wish you'd told me. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish she'd told me. It was a unilateral Caroline decision. Will you make sausage and peppers? DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Tyler, Your father is driving me crazy. I shouldn't even be discussing this with you. I can't get him to say he'll come to your sister's exhibit. Her art exhibit. He says he's in the middle of an IPO. Tyler rubs his eyes. DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Les says I shouldn't broker. I should let them be on whatever road they're on. Beat. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get him there. DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cares about this, even though she's pretending she doesn't. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get him there, mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She looks relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you. She kisses his cheek, and rises to go. He takes her to th door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you bring that lovely girl to your birthday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a warning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Sorry. I love you, darling, but this place reeks of marijuana. She goes, shutting the door behind her. 60   EXT. ROOFTOP -- AFTER. Aidan and Ally on the roof, they've arranged themselves i the deck chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was weird. I assume most moms don't smoke weed in front of their son's...um

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piece of ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're a poet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I know one thing. I know that in the time I've lived with Tyler, he has never introduced a girl ... woman...female...to his mom before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like he had a choice. She ambushed us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but he would've shoved you in a closet or something. Or literally pretended you were a hallucination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it. It's the first time. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it ever occur to you that that's kind of weird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Ally throws up her hands. 61   INT.   BATHROOM. AFTER. Tyler, having pulled the decrepit house phone into the bathroom, is leaning against the sink, girding himself to call Charles. He looks in the mirror and makes a face.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CHARLES' OFFICE . JUST AFTER
dialogues.text: Janine pokes her head into Charles' office. Charles is swamped with work and surrounded by UNDERLINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles, it's your son. Charles is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He punches a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler, you're on speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about Caroline's show. Are you planning on attending?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? There are people here. You'll have to speak up. Tyler holds the phone away from his face and screams at i silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline's show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ready to kill him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are coming, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Yes. I'm coming. We'll go to dinner first. Alright?... (to Janine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner? That's not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make a reservation and have Janine call you. He hangs up. Tyler stares at the phone a sec, then hits h head, once, against the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler is sitting at the table in the darkened room with A standing behind him with her hands over his eyes. Caroline enters from the kitchen carrying Tyler's BIRTHDA CAKE. She has obviously decorated it herself. She has dra (as best as she could, given the medium) the characters f the ALICE statue in frosting. It reads "A VERY MERRY UNBIRTHDAY TO YOU", and has "22" i numerical candles and "+ 1 TO UNGROW ON" written next to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's singing. Aidan, Ally, Diane are all singing. There's a flash from a camera off screen. It's Les. Caroline puts the cake down in front of her brother and A takes her hands away just as they finish the song. Tyler's face in the candlelight as he sees Caroline's efforts. He takes a huge breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make a wish. He looks at her and blows out the candles. Everybody applauds, Diane longer than anyone else. Her eyes are shining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cake totally devoured. Les is obsessively eating frosting. Caroline is trying to teach Aidan how to waltz in the liv room. He is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Retarded. Tyler? Tyler rises from the sofa and takes over as Caroline's partner. She puts her feet on top of his feet and they wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "One, two. three. One, two, three" Ally and Diane are washing dishes in silence. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the second member of this family I've washed dishes with. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was doing it to impress you. He's never washed a dish in his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline at her desk, sketching. Her door is ajar. Ally enters, mouth agape as she lays eyes on Caroline's collec of artwork on the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Caroline's working on a PORTRAIT OF TYLER ON A PARK BENCH cigarette dangling from his bottom lip. A perfect renderi of a fleeting moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I? Caroline shrugs. Ally looks over Caroline's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly him. It's like the cigarette is the last Coca Cola in the desert. Caroline smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe he smokes in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'm not that impressionable. Ally smiles. Caroline goes back to work. Ally looks aroun all the portraits papering her walls. It stirs a memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know when I was younger, we didn't have air conditioning in the house, so during the summer my mom and I would go to museums to cool down... she loved them all but The Met was always her favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine too. The Met is one of my favorite places in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... I heard you've got an art exhibit coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it that obvious? But only if you're OK with it. I don't want to impose and I'll completely understand if you don't want some random girl there. Caroline considers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not random... you're Tyler's girlfriend. Ally has never heard anyone say it so plainly. She seems bit perplexed, then grins. It's okay with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler wearing the suit we met him in, it's been dry-clean Ally emerges from the bathroom, looking gorgeous in a vin black cocktail dress and carrying a pink wrap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just skip dinner and I'll tell you how great you look in like eighteen different languages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just want to skip dinner. I got you a tie. She hands him a simple blue tie that matches his eyes. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to make a joke about how I'm not prepared for the commitment of exchanging accessories and how neck wear especially is a slippery slope, but I should probably shut up and say thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're learning. Tyler puts on his tie in the mirror. He scowls. 68   INT. FOUR SEASONS RESTAURANT -- AFTER. Tyler and Ally sip cocktails at the nicest table in the place. There's an empty seat. Tyler's eyes flicker toward the door. Twice. He touches his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been here? Ally tries to lighten his mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Every Tuesday with my pop. This goes right past Tyler whose eyes flicker towards the door again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's allowed to stand me up. But he's not allowed to stand you up. Or my sister. Tyler finishes his drink, signals a WAITER who glides to table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me one too... Like a stealth bomber. At least this moment rescued the m from actually having to greet each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. For the lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, thank you. The waiter goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Alicia Craig. Ally, my father, Charles Roth. Charles gives a courtly nod and takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty wine bottle. Charles cuts into a one-hundred dol steak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be a social worker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But with an area of focused responsibility. It's easier to find a job that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will your area be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criminal Justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was little I wanted to play first base for the Mets. I don't think it's any harder than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mets, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arching an eyebrow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from Rockaway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad's a Yankee fan. It has something to do with the payroll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has to do with significant ball playing. You were a Yankees fan when you were little. You were Lou Piniella for Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blind familial allegiance. I didn't know what overpriced, overfed, fat bastards they were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious as a heart attack) Who's fat? What Yankee is fat? Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right back at him) It's a metaphor... Charles adjusts his tie and goes back to his steak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger Clemens. Charles looks at his son. Puts his fork down. Silence at the table. Back to the steak. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane Spencer. Charles looks up, taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick Johnson. Tyler tries to get a word in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his mouth full of steak) He's big boned! Charles and Ally burst out laughing. Tyler rolls his eyes

dialogues.speaker: --TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Dessert. Ally is working on an enormous profiterole. Tyle another whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has your dad been a cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-two years. His cell phone lights up. Charles gently puts his hand on hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you excuse me please... I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK. Charles gets up from the table. Tyler, not able to help himself, shoots him a glance. Ally clocks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a call. He held out 'til dessert. Charles returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...And your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She passed away when I was eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was murdered. I was there. Charles and Tyler are stunned to silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tyler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never told you that part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you saying this now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. The men look at her. She's a hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, here you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. Here I am. 70   INT. CRAIG FAMILY HOME. KITCHEN. There is an empty Lean Cuisine box, and two empty Beer Ca on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig stands by the microwave as it counts down...4,3,2,1 BEEP. He removes an Eggplant Parmigiana and slides it carefully on to a waiting plate. He takes it, along with a fresh beer, to the living room. sits heavily on the sofa and hits a remote, unpausing ERI BROCKOVICH.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. IN FRONT OF THE FOUR SEASONS-- LATER
dialogues.text: Tyler and Ally wait in front of the restaurant as Charles takes another call. A TOWN CAR and DRIVER wait as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's lovely. Tyler puts his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. Charles returns. His face blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go to the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have somewhere else to be, Dad. Charles adjusts his tie. Tyler loosens his. Ally is unsure where to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exhibit runs til nine. You guys take the car. I'll meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all there is, Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to justify anything to you. Take the car. I'll get a cab. I'll meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps into the street to hail a cab. Tyler watches his dad get into a taxi, then holds the car door for Ally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amateur artwork and picked over catering. The rest of the exhibitors are high school age, even a college freshman o two. They mill with their friends and families. Animated. Ally and Aidan stand before a COLLECTION OF FAMILIAR PORTRAITS (Charles reading the paper at breakfast, Les an Diane kissing, Tyler on the park bench). Caroline sits on a catering table, Tyler next to her. She looks miserable, he looks furious. Diane bustles over wit plate of cupcakes and a big stupid grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you every flavor. Caroline looks once at her mom then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tyler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready to go home now. Tyler nods, takes her hand. Calls to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally...? Les, eating a cupcake, and Ally, stand under a portrait o Charles. Ally picks up her purse. Diane standing there wi her cupcakes.

dialogues.speaker: INT. RAILROAD FLAT. RIGHT AFTER
dialogues.text: Tyler, visibly agitated, is letting Ally in the front doo the apartment. He grabs his bike off the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something I've got to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now? Ally reaches for his elbow. He yanks his arm away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you capable of taking care of yourself for an hour? Do you need me here every minute, or what? He slams out. Ally looks like she's been slapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles in a meeting with several SUBORDINATES. Everyone in late night disarray. They are obviously on their way t pulling an all-nighter. The door to the office flies open Tyler barges in. Janine trailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler? Tyler? You can't just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine Janine. There is space between the two men. Tyler extends a rolle piece of paper to his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drew you a picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on the table. Beat. Tyler holds on to the portrait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a daughter who sincerely believes you don't like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I have any questions about what my daughter may believe, I'll let you know. Tyler gestures with the portrait

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you at least want to know her? She's telling you something, Dad. She's communicating. Why aren't you riveted? Why isn't this the most important thing? At least for one night of your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard this song before, Tyler. SUBORDINATE#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can come back... The subordinates rise. CHARLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine, Khaleel. They sit. There is still distance between the two men. Beat. CHARLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this display for? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, Mr. Roth. Beat. CHARLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows I will take care of her. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...? The subordinates rise again. SUBORDINATE#1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We really can come back another... CHARLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit the fuck down. They sit. CHARLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that I love her. I love her. Good God, you toss that word around like currency. You have no idea what it means. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not. Maybe Caroline doesn't either. Where would she have learned it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have provided her world. And yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That does not mean you're allowed to shatter it whenever there's something better to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell do you think you're talking to? You pedaled down here on your bike for Christ's sake. You have to take care of nothing. You are responsible for no one. You're a kid. You think you're the first one to lose anything? Do you think that there is anything you feel that I haven't already felt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't find him. I found him. And you're so tragically blind, the rest of your children are going to hang themselves on your watch. Charles goes, snarling, for his son, and Tyler is more th willing. Janine and one of the Subordinates get between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop! The men are pulled apart. Tyler is white and trembling wi rage. Charles' face is completely dark and closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here Tyler. Tyler runs for the door. Stumbling over furniture, Caroli portrait crushed under his feet. 75   INT. RAILROAD FLAT -- RIGHT AFTER. Ally, still in her dress, trying to excavate an ice tray frozen in the ancient freezer. There's got to be six inch of frost in there. She starts stabbing it with a wooden spoon. As she hears the door, she turns and puts on her m blistering attitude like an overcoat. As Tyler walks into light-- his face white with anger, practically crying-- h eyes widen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. She runs to him, he falls into her. He's a mess. He won't her see his face. She pushes at his hair, trying to see a understand. He kisses her, so she won't see. Tyler is completely lost in the storm and Alicia Santana Craig is going to get him through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. She yanks his head up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. They kiss. She brings his hands up into her hair, around face. They kiss. He kisses her like he's starved for her.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Tyler and Ally, wrapped around each other, both deeply asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, home from work. He hits the button on the answerin machine. There's just one message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the machine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, it's me. I've been invited...I'm going away to the beach for Labor Day...They're nice people. If there's any problem I'll call. Or they will. Okay...Bye. As he takes off his jacket, Craig hits rewind and plays t message again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the machine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, it's me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raucous laughter. Caroline, Tyler, Les, Ally and Aidan ar the living room playing charades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is a little sunburnt, the adults are a little dr Ally is wrapped up in Tyler, Caroline is on her mom's lap the floor, Les next to them, lying on his stomach. Aidan up and God only knows what he's doing LES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (totally flabbergasted) I genuinely have no idea...are you having a seizure? CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Berlin Alexanderplatz! More raucous laughter. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You people are culturally bankrupt. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose was that anyway? CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine. Whoops of laughter heretofore unheard in Montauk. DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you. Bed. LES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? Yeah, baby. CAROLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gross. Gross. Gross me out the door. She rises and flees into the kitchen. Les rolls over and up with his head in Diane's lap. He looks at her for a moment. LES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just the prettiest girl. Diane beams at him. Tyler smiles at his mom and Les, then at Ally. Diane take deep look at her son. Her eyes shining. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy crap. What's with all the smiling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline travels through the living room with a popsicle. is headed for her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A child could do Berlin Alexanderplatz, you spaz. Les snorts with laughter. Diane rises, dumping him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want five minutes with my child before she ceases to be a child and decides I'm ruining her life. On her way out, Diane pauses and gently pushes one of All stray curls behind her ear. Smiles down at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you a treasure. Ally stares up at Diane for a beat, her eyes shining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanned and rejuvenated, Ally, Tyler, and Aidan sit togeth on the train back to the city. Ally and Tyler kiss. Aidan watches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinners out, movies. Regular sex. That could be all right. For like, a summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such a romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I've had all the races.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had all the races. I've been with girls from every...race. Ally laughs. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the stupidest thing you've ever said, including that time with the bong in the emergency room. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White girl. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Like falling off a log. As a matter of fact... ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Black girl. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But of course. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asian. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Latina. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui! ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Latin girl actually slept with you? What's her name? She's out of the club. Tyler is laughing. Ally thinks for a moment. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eskimo. Aidan gives a satisfied smile. TYLER/ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way! AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica Ipellie. She works at the Public Library on 96th street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You slept with an Eskimo? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went to the library? The car doors open and a MAN ushers his family through. Craig's partner Leo, in plain clothes. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inuit. In-u-it, Ally. Try not to show your ignorance. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Nice girl. While we were doing it, I couldn't get this little, like, song out of my head... He begins to bob his head to a rhythm. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Inuit, bum buh bum, I'm banging an Inuit, bum buh bum buh bum..." Ally and Tyler collapse in laughter as Craig's Partner pa He notices Ally immediately. She doesn't see him. He take long look at Tyler as he follows his wife and kids into t next car. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prove it. Ten bucks. The train makes a stop at Patchogue. Leo and family disembark. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna go to the library? ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minute we get off this train. AIDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler, are you coming? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll skip this particular bloodbath, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler, his bag on his shoulder, returning home, fishing i his pocket for his keys. He sings the Inuit song to himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bum buh bum bum buh bum buh bum... His front door is unlocked. Tyler freezes. Takes a beat. Scans the room, silently dropping his bag. He reaches behind him for the aluminium against the door. Wielding it, he takes two steps into th apartment. Craig, in plain clothes, sitting on Tyler's bed, amidst t carnage of Tyler's stuff. He has been rifling through everything. The guitar is propped haphazardly against the wall. Craig looks up. The men lock eyes. Craig's eyes go to the bat. Tyler leans it slowly against the wall. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in my house? Craig's eyes flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not here now. She's at the library. Craig's face says it: "Bullshit".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she know? Cops never ask a question they don't know the answer to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think so. I figured you'd probably leave that up to me when you're done with her. Craig's face, like his wife's so many years ago, is pure contempt. With his body at this angle, Tyler can now see gun. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere. CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true, Tyler Roth, son of Charles and Diane. Brother of Caroline and Michael, deceased, suicide by hanging. You're kinda lost, aren't you? Taking a little vacation in coach before finding your way back to first class? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the one she came to when you used her face as a punching bag. Craig closes the distance. From Tyler's P.O.V he looks like a freight train. In a flash, he gets Tyler in a choke hold, flips him on h back on the bed and puts his hands around Tyler's throat. Silence, except for exertion. Tyler's hands are on Craig's wrists. He is holding Craig' eye. His face is starting to turn colors. Beat. Beat. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs you. It travels between the two men. Craig grappling with it, although he still has his hands at Tyler's throat. Craig drops his hands, pushes himself off Tyler Tyler rolls to one side, coughing and gagging. Craig leans against the wall for support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is trying, before our eyes, to pull the shards of hims together. His gun visible at his waistband. Tyler's coughing, his face still red, his eyes travel bri to the bat, then to Craig. Craig closes his eyes, very briefly, then rises. Not look at Tyler. Beat. Looking at Tyler. Beat. Craig goes to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a fucking dead bolt. Slam. And then he's gone. The door bounces in its frame. then it's just Tyler trying to remember how to breathe. 81   INT. RAILROAD FLAT-- LATER. Tyler smoking, standing at the window, waiting for Ally. sees her walking up to the front door. He grinds his cigarette out. Ally is running up the stairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler Keats Roth! She arrives at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He banged an Inuit! She's really nice. And smart. I don't get it. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I got home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate him! She lunges for the phone. Tyler stops her hand. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more. She looks like she's starting to panic. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows me. Before I met you. He arrested me and Aidan. He gave me that gash over my eye. ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mouthed off to him. He ... responded. Then Aidan saw you guys together at school. She isn't quite getting it. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aidan suggested...I...introduced myself to you. She's got it. Beat. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally... ALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to be sick. She bolts from the chair to the sink and dry heaves. Tyle reaches out to comfort her. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. She reels around and cracks him across the face. Not like chick. Like her dad. The sound hangs in the air. Ally goes to the bedroom and starts throwing her stuff in bag. Tyler follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you realize what you've done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you think I would never find out? I mean, think about it. I had to find out eventually. You set it up that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it doesn't mean anything. I didn't mean to hurt you,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's exactly what you meant to do. She pushes past him and out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally heads down. Aidan heads up. He smiles wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Ally pushes past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prick.

dialogues.speaker: INT. RAILROAD FLAT-- LATER THAT NIGHT
dialogues.text: Tyler sitting on the ratty couch. Aidan eats old Chinese from the container. He offers some to Tyler. They sit in silence. Tyler swelling. Aidan eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to tell her eventually... This is no comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass half full... you just saved yourself an awkward Thanksgiving. Sincere now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be back, T. Tyler heads into his bedroom and shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Craig working on a sink full of dirty dishes. He scrubs at a filthy pan with a piece of steel wool. He's m but there's not a beer can in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you're not supposed to use that on non-stick pans... Craig turns, finds her there in the doorway, bag at her f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes off the teflon. They stare at each other for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should let it soak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. They look at each other. Craig tries a smile. Ally's cool with him. Moving towards him, past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline and Diane walk up to the DOORMAN. Caroline carri gift, a sleeping bag. Diane smiles at her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop smiling. You look insane. Diane can't help it try as she might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, honey. I just... it's nice. Like an end of the summer send off. Caroline rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun. Caroline goes into the lobby. Diane heads back to her car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline gives her gift to THE BIRTHDAY GIRL who smiles. follows her into the next room where the other PARTY GUES watch a movie. They all turn and look at Caroline. Caroline smiles sheepishly. Some of the MEAN GIRLS are th One of them gives her a perfunctory smile.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT.
dialogues.text: Jackie Chan's foot slamming through a wall. Tyler and Aidan are watching RUSH HOUR 2. Aidan slurps from a super mega sized soda, laughing, enjo himself. He turns to his friend. Tyler sits, completely drained, looking like the loneliest guy on the planet. Aidan gives him a nudge. Tyler looks at the screen for a and half smiles, then slips away again. Aidan is genuinel concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party girl's MOM is in a bathrobe. She looks horrifie she has one hand covering her mouth and is whispering int cell phone. Caroline is on the kitchen phone. Her long ha has been CUT TO PIECES while she slept. She is crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally and her father cook breakfast together. There's a kn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aidan paces nervously. Craig appears in an apron. Aidan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the, uh, that is, does, uh, Alicia Craig. Does she live here? Craig nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great. I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I don't remember you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it Dad? Ally sees Aidan. She touches her father's forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK... Craig steps back into the house. Six inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. He backs into the hall. Aidan and Ally are alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm a prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... Craig popping back like an eel from a wreck.    He's got mangled Honey Bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes again. Pfft. Aidan's visibly relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler's not. She starts to close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Shit. This isn't really my thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lied to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd like to think he is. Aidan doesn't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what that means...I've seen him look at one other girl the way he looks at you. She's a lot shorter and shares his DNA. Ally looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to forgive him today... just forgive him. Craig reappears from the deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for stopping by. Father and daughter go back into the house. Aidan exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane is on the house phone, preparing a tray of tea and cinnamon toast for Caroline as she talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling me, Ms. Spencer, that you intend to let those girls stay in your school?...Of course they're all sticking to the same story and that story is a load of crap!... She slams a cabinet closed as Les picks up the tray and W TRACK HIM down the hall to CAROLINE'S ROOM. Les is speaki on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto, into the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pretty traumatized. I wanted to pull some names together in case we all decide she should talk to someone... 92   INT. CAROLINE'S BEDROOM. Caroline and Tyler are lying on Caroline's bed. Her head nestled on his shoulder. She looks even tinier than usual Tyler is reading to her, softly, from The Book of Greek Myths, his other hand stroking her butchered hair. She looks pale, wasted. Her eyes are sunken and she's fighting sleep. A losing battle, she's exhausted. Her lid finally shutter to the sound of her brother's voice. Les, at the door, places the tray on Caroline's desk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no witnesses and it didn't happen on school property. The school won't do anything. They'll probably get away with it... Tyler's eyes, registering anger and shock, jump from the as he hears this. 93   INT. FOYER. Diane opening the front door for Aidan and Ally. Aidan wr his arms around Diane and gives her a hug. Ally hangs bac bit, unsure, then embraces Diane. Tyler emerges from the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Diane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's asleep. He sees Aidan and Ally. Stops short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler alone on the top stair, taking long pulls from a cigarette. Ally comes out the front door, softly closes i behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last one ever. I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're not here for me but, thank you for being here. A silent moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what it's worth, I think you're amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not worth much. You made everything between us a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Now what? I'm supposed to just forgive you? A BMW 7 Series speeds around the corner. Stops in front o the house. Charles gets out of the car, sees his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's sleeping. Diane emerges from the house. Charles strides quickly tow her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline asleep in her bed. Charles stands in the doorway watching her sleep, we get the feeling he hasn't seen her asleep in some time. Diane appears at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you think she'll sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she'll be out for a while. Would you like to wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I can't. I'll call her later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell her. Diane looks at Charles. He's still watching his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline's TEACHER prepares her lesson plan. She starts t write the date on the board when The door opens. Caroline Tyler enter. The entire class is watching. It's dead quie Caroline puts her trembling hands in her pockets. Tyler looks at a few of the girls. They look back, unconcerned, almost amused. Tyler walks his sister to her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Caroline, whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Caroline nods, although her eyes are brimming. As she sli out of her jacket, the contents of her pockets clatter noisily to the floor. Tyler immediately bends to help her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you done something different with your hair? I love it! SNICKERING LAUGHTER. Caroline looks like a deer in headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler moves towards an EMPTY DESK. Some girls keep snickering. Suddenly, Tyler grabs the desk. THROWS it thr the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JANITOR pushes a flat broom down the empty corridor whe the glass from one of the classroom doors explodes as the desk makes impact. He stops pushing the broom and stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pin-drop silence. The students sit paralyzed. Tyler stare the Mean Girl. Her arrogance completely gone. Caroline st up at her brother, awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TYLER locked up among CRACK HEADS and PETTY CROOKS on a d bench with his hands behind his head and a bemused smirk. BAILIFF approaches the holding cell. Looks at Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You posted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles standing in the waiting area. Tyler is led out by bailiff rubbing his wrists. He sees his father, his face registering surprise. Beat. The men walk together towards the exit in silence. Neithe looking at the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destruction of private property and felony trespassing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you didn't. Charles stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have unleashed a raging shitstorm of epic proportions on the board of trustees of that pissant school that will not abate until those girls seek enrollment elsewhere. I give them a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you think I'm a prick, but I have my uses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you come by the office to talk to the lawyers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Tyler deciding. Tyler nods. Charles appraises his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try not to vandalize any more schools in the meantime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles walks ahead, pulling out his cell phone. Tyler calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for bailing me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles, without turning around,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler leaning against the bike rack, waiting. He sees All running up the steps and watches her as she blends into t crowd. 102   EXT. WASHINGTON SQUARE PARK -- JUST AFTER. No mimes, just dealers. Ally with a girlfriend, walking towards the East Side. Tyler catches up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shakes the friend's hand. After a beat, Ally agrees to wa with him. He reaches for her hand. She pulls it away, but walks next to him. 103   EXT. CENTRAL PARK -- ALICE STATUE -- JUST AFTER. Tyler has convinced Ally to come uptown and meet Caroline with him. Tyler and Caroline climb all over the Alice, while Ally watches from a bench. As befitting a seventh grader, Caroline turns her face to sun and arranges herself to take advantage of the early September tanning possibilities. Tyler walks over to Ally's bench, sits next to her. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using the little sister is dirty pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it working? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Tyler has a smile the size of New York City. Ally smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright sun pouring through the window. Ally lying asleep. Tyler is up and dressed now, he grabs his journal off his desk, kneels beside Ally. He is bathed in the pool of lig streaming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nuzzling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back in an hour. I have to stop by my dad's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sleepily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want french toast or pancakes for breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whichever tastes better a la mode. Ally smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hi to your dad for me. Tyler watches her lying there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I said I love you... what would you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too. Tyler kisses her. Then heads out into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aidan passed out on the couch still wearing the clothes h went out in the night before. Tyler watches him sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without opening his eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French toast. Tyler smiles as he takes his journal and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles waiting on the doorstep, his Town Car waiting on curb. Diane answers the door expecting to find Caroline's driver, she's confused to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning Diane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler's coming by the office, but I thought I'd ride to school with Caroline first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane is speechless. This is a first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...OK...sure...yeah...great. She's not ready though, she's going to need at least twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles hates waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adjusting his tie) All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler chaining up his bike. His cellphone rings. He check it. Knows what it's regarding before he answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you canceling all together or are you just running late?

dialogues.speaker: INT. CHARLES' TOWN CAR-- MORNING
dialogues.text: Charles and Caroline in the back seat. She's on one side, with her pink back pack, he's on the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Are you already on your way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler rounding a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm already here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking Caroline to school. He looks at his daughter. She looks back at him, then loo out the window. Tyler considers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time. I'll just wait in your office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may be a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. Tyler hangs up and joins the herds of suits heading down street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler riding in a handsome marble and oak elevator with a half-dozen EXECUTIVE types. Tyler steps on and presses th number 92. The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler walks, approaches the Receptionist from the ashtray incident. He smiles pleasantly. She doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She went for coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She getting me any? Just kidding. Tyler heads down the hall. The Receptionist rolls her eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler steps into his father's empty office. It's dark, qu He opens the blinds. Sunlight fills the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler walks around the office. Picking things up, putting them back. Tyler sits at his father's desk in his executive chair. H leans back. Puts his feet up and his hands behind his hea Tyler notices the COMPUTER. He turns on the monitor and p his hand on the mouse - but doesn't move it. His hand jus stops and stays perfectly still. Tyler stares at the moni where his dad's SCREEN SAVER is scrolling through PHOTOS. These photos are all of his FAMILY... "Michael's first Christmas, Tyler's eighth birthday, Diane in the hospital with Caroline in a pink blanket, Charles and his kids bui sand castle at the shore"... they just keep going. Tyler finds himself watching a slide show of his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That line of luxury cars dropping their daughters off. Charles' Town car rolls to a stop. Caroline gives him a k on the cheek. It registers, sort of. She gets out. Charle watches her all the way into the school. His DRIVER sees him watching Caroline in the rear view mirror. Charles gives the Driver a look "you're waiting for an invite?" The Driver peels out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally has made a mess making french toast. Aidan is yakkin his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles in traffic. All around him DRIVERS curse, honk, h each other. Charles rides, not letting it bug him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline drawing at her desk as her Teacher comes in and ready to start the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler is still watching the screen saver when Janine ente

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Morning, Mister Roth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know about this? Janine walks around the desk in time to see a photo of Ty and Michael naked in the tub pop up. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think scanned all the pictures? Tyler smiles. Janine smiles, Then a photo of Michael come up. Those smiles fade. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old would he be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-nine last May. Tyler stands and looks out one of the floor-to-ceiling windows separated by columns. He stares out at mid town a perfect blue sky. Janine looks befuddled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really been that long? I could've sworn it was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May 18, 1993. A silent moment passes. Janine reflecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be able to remember that. I'm sorry. Tyler looks at her, his face easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline's Teacher writes the date on the board as Caroli sits quietly doodling. The teacher looks her way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline? Hello? WIDE SHOT of the blackboard. It's unmistakable: SEPTEMBER 11, 2001

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're now looking at Tyler from just outside Charles' off window and we're PULLING BACK... Until we see Tyler framed in the window surrounded by eer familiar grey metal siding... Until we see can barely see Tyler and the base of a giant white antenna... Until we can no longer see Tyler as he's disappeared into composite of the building and we've pulled back far enoug reveal that Tyler is standing in a window on the... 92nd Floor of The North Tower of the World Trade Center. A moment of still perfect silence. The Towers. The blue s Then we hear the faint sound of AA Flight 11's ENGINES as closes in on the North Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Darkness. We wait in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you do in life will be insignificant but it is very important that you do it because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles Roth steps out of his car. His gaze fixed skyward All around him the other DRIVERS mimic his behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good bet...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DIANE'S BROWNSTONE STOOP-- LATER
dialogues.text: Diane sweeping cigarette butts off the stoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody else will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane joins a group of ONLOOKERS staring up from a street corner in Brooklyn where the black smoke stains the blue One of them has a radio to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael... Diane staring at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's been trying to tell me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig, through a LONG LENS standing by his car with the d open. He is, crystal clear, barking orders, while waves o blue and slashes of orange float around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aidan and Ally absolutely frantic on the roof. Holding ha Craning to see. Ash begins to float down on them. It gets caught in Ally's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This girl! Ally! Her life, even the nightmare parts seeped into me and I swear to God I can hear you better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door flies open. Caroline runs out into the empty hall, the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that about? I've always been the worst listener.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PAPER, so much of it, all of it singed, smoke-stained falling like snow flakes coating the streets and the sidewalks. Amongst the memos and faxes that will now neve sent and never received we find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone comes into your life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light rain falls. Two TOMBSTONES stand side-by-side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June 17, 1978 September 11, 2001 Charles, Caroline, Diane and Les approach the tombstones. family mourning. Diane slips her hand through Charles' el The gesture seems quite natural, easy.

dialogues.speaker: INT. NYU DORM-- DAY
dialogues.text: We find Ally, with a ROOMMATE, putting up lively, Indian Print curtains in their NYU dorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline literally dragging Charles into the ROSE BUILDIN LINCOLN CENTER, while he yells into his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And half of you says "Danger! Stay in your cave! You're nowhere near ready!" Caroline has come to the end of her rope with her dad. Sh grabs his phone and throws it into the fountain, spins on heel and marches into the auditorium. Charles is complete thunderstruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the other half -- and this is the part I think is you -- He is torn between his phone and his daughter for a sec, chooses Caroline and takes off after her... ...then comes running out by himself to rescue his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig is wearing a jacket and tie. He's on a date with a pretty WOMAN. In his confusion over the menu, he knocks o a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says "Go get her! Immediately! Make her yours forever!"

dialogues.speaker: INT. DIANE'S OFFICE-- DAY
dialogues.text: A chaotic place, filled with folk who need help. Diane at desk, organizing families.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on the forever part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aidan actually awake in class. He has a tattoo on his forearm. "Tyler".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have to step up my game. But I'm glad I listened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ally, we find her as we first found her mother, silhouett against the Lower Manhattan skyline where two beams of pu light reach up forever where the Towers once stood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. Her train pulls into the station. Ally boards with a few other commuters. She takes a seat by herself across from. A MOM and A TODDLER, a little girl. The baby is squirming impossibly, the mom looks exhausted. Ally watches them, remembers him, as the faintest hint of smile crosses her lips the subway lights flicker and we..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a stranger.
